description.narrative: Strengthened national response to COVID-19 through provision of uninterrupted solar energy to health facilities responding to COVID-19

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: # of health facilities supported % increase in number of COVID-19-related services including tests provided per health facility Number of micro, small and medium-sized enterprises utilizing supplier development platforms for inclusive and sustainable value chains # of women & youth accessing financial services and non-financial assets, # of people benefiting from jobs and improved livelihoods in crisis or post-crisis settings # of boreholes restored and functional # of people with improved access to clean water # and proportion of women among beneficiaries of recovery programs

comment.narrative: 3 Number of health facilities supported 0 % increase in number of COVID-19-related services including tests provided per health facility 0 Number of micro, small and medium-sized enterprises utilizing supplier development platforms for inclusive and sustainable value chains 0 Number of women & youth accessing financial services and non-financial assets, 0 Number of people benefiting from jobs and improved livelihoods in crisis or post-crisis settings 0 Number of boreholes restored and functional 0 Number of people with improved access to clean water 0 Number and proportion of women among beneficiaries of recovery programmes

The project has 3 mutually reinforcing outputs geared to protect poor and vulnerable people from aggravated hardship caused by COVID-19, the main outputs is 1) strengthened the national COVID-19 response by the provision of hybrid solar-power energy solution to two healthcare facilities in Seiyun 2) restoration of livelihoods though support the MSMEs by the provision business skills training for 500 beneficiaries and to provide hybrid solar tuk-tuk for 145 beneficiaries in Seiyun 3) strengthen the COVID-19 prevention at community level by the provision of clean drinking water through solar powered desalination plant. 10 MSMEs will be provided by seed grants of 900USD to run a linked micro-enterprises.

Q1 Under output 1, an energy gap assessment conducted for Seiyun COVID-19 isolation center to see what the gaps in energy are to provide a solar system. Based on the assessment results the procurement process started, and the technical analysis is ongoing. Under output 2, the selection of IP is ongoing. No actual achievements till date. Under output 3, coordination with local authorities is ongoing for identifying salty boreholes in Seiyun to implement a desalination plant. Coordination is with centralized governorate in Mukalla and with local authorities in Seiyun.
Q2 Under output 1, the supplier who will install the solar system in Seiyun COVID-19 isolation unite has been selected and they are under progress to start providing the items. The installation is planned to be completed in mid-October 2021. Under output 2, the RPA signed with SOUL for development, all coordination conducted has been done with all stakeholders and local authorities in Seiyun. A community mobilization activity has been conducted along with a radio broad cast to select the potential beneficiaries. Under output 3, a water quality test conducted for 5 boreholes in Bur area in Seiyun district. All results raised to procurement to start the procurement of the desalination plant from a PIGGYBACK to expedite the procurement process. A well survey raised to the suppler to start providing the specification for the plant. for Q3) 2 of health facilities supported and is on going in installation of the solar system. 500 households has been identified and will be provided by business skill training and technical maintenance tuk tuk training. 150 tuk tuk planned to be arrived Q4 and 145 will be distributed for beneficiaries and 5 to disassembly. procurement is ongoing for the desalination plant to e installed in Burr area in Seiyun district.
Q3 Under output 1, the installation of the solar hybrid system is ongoing, and expected to be completed by the Q4. a business training has been conducted for output 2 to all 500 individuals. a pre and post exercise conducted and the data under analysis with the MEAL unite under SOUL for development. the procurement process is ongoing in terms of the solar tuk-tuks. for output 3, the arrangements to install the desalination unite is on progress, the coordination is ongoing and all documentations and approvals to be taken from local authorities and the relevant stakeholders.
Q4 Output 1: few challenges faced the installation of the hybrid solar system for Seiyun COVID-19 isolation center. there was a shortage in items and the team will cover the gap the soonest. the system expected to be completed by the end of Q4.
Output 2: the coordination still ongoing with golden-relief to expedite the shipment progress, all relevant approvals from ministries and local authorities are ready.
Output 3: the location of installing the RO unite has been change to some difficulties of getting the approval from the land owner. the team worked to get the approvals for the second option and the supplier will start the installation of the unite.

The project has 3 mutually reinforcing outputs geared to protect poor and vulnerable people from aggravated hardship caused by COVID-19, the main outputs is 1) strengthened the national COVID-19 response by the provision of hybrid solar-power energy solution to two healthcare facilities in Seiyun 2) restoration of livelihoods though support the MSMEs by the provision business skills training for 500 beneficiaries and to provide hybrid solar tuk-tuk for 145 beneficiaries in Seiyun 3) strengthen the COVID-19 prevention at community level by the provision of clean drinking water through solar powered desalination plant. 10 MSMEs will be provided by seed grants of 900USD to run a linked micro-enterprises.

Q1 Output 1 the installation of the hybrid solar system for Seiyun COVID-19 isolation center completed and the launch conducted in the beginning of January 2022.
Output 2: 1- Business development training, which was conducted for 484 (278 males and 206 females), a total of 473 beneficiaries submitted their business proposals.
2- 14 basic training sessions conducted for total of 350 beneficiaries on the mechanical and electrical part.
3- a total of 96 tuk-tuks distributed in Seiyun district which 91 distributed among beneficaries and 5 tuk-tuks which used in the maintenance training, were handed over to the district director to distribute them to the below local authorities and entities after providing signed letter
a) Vocational training Institute b) Seiyun General Hospital. c) Commerce and Industry Office. d) Public Works Project office. e) dialysis center.
4 - Distribute the Conditional Cash Grants for the 145 winning business owner
Output 3: 1 - the work on the desalination unite is ongoing 2 - the selection of beneficiaries who will do the salt production completed 3 - salt making curriculum created 4 - the selection of salt production trainer completed.
